stages.logText: You had entered a very unnatural looking fog and decided to find the source of it. Maybe you could lift the fog?
After you chased away a fog monster, the fog suddenly dissipated.
Another fog monster guarded the footbridge to the hut. As long as there was still fog somewhere around the hut, you couldn't drive it away.
In the hut you encountered a terrifying looking witch.
You defeated the old witch in battle, so she can't create a new fog.
You were able to convince the witch Mim to keep the road clear of fog.
You convinced the witch Mim to replace the fog with a distraction spell.
Madame Mim gave you a bottle of her swamp water.
1=Fog 1 has lifted
2=Fog 2 has lifted
3=Fog 3 has lifted
4=Fog 4 has lifted
5=Fog 5 has lifted
6=Fog 1 normal
7=Fog 1 short
8=Fogs shortened
9=Fogs ended
10=Board
1=Stolen from offering to Elythara
The PC threw an Oegyth Crystal down the well in Wexlow Village.
The PC has attacked Gamjee the troll under the village of Wexlow without knowing that Gamjee has those villagers held captive.
The PC has attacked Gamjee the troll under the village of Wexlow after learning that Gamjee has those villagers held captive.
The PC has attacked Gamjee the troll under the village of Wexlow.
Gamjee, the troll under the village of Wexlow has sent the villager back to Wexlow.
PC gave Godwin, a villager from Wexlow, his lost ring. [wrapper for 13, 14, 15]
PC gave Godwin, a villager from Wexlow, his lost ring for free.
PC gave Godwin, a villager from Wexlow, his lost ring for 2k gold.
PC gave Godwin, a villager from Wexlow, his lost ring for 3k gold.
PC learns that Rosmara sells fruits and vegetables
PC can sleep in Wexlow Village.
PC has learned what the beekeeper, Leofric does for work.
In Wexlow Village, the PC has learned that there are missing residents.
20=Road to Feygard closed (wayto_feygard_duleian_2)
PC is not being patient while waiting for the Feydelight to be cooked.
boat0 clear
boat0 sunk
boat0 save
60=talked to Arthamyr
61=ladder placed
62=tried window
63=church window unlocked
65=jewel taken
66=passed window towards tailor

71=ladder place 1
72=ladder place 2

80=Path open
81=Godoe in the south
90=Ravine blocked
91=Ravine outlets blocked
92=Ravine free
On the road to Feygard I have met a boy named Tobby. He is looking for his brother Sobby.
I have promised to help Tobby get past the kobolds to the south.
I have killed the rat in Tobby's garden.
I gave Tobby a loaf of bread for his father.
Tobby has followed me to the beginning of the ravine with the kobolds.
Tobby has made it through the ravine.
Tobby followed me further to the south.
I have attacked poor Tobby, but he ran away. Now he will never find his brother.
We have parted. Tobby was sure now to find his brother.
I have met Tobby again, together with Sobby in the little village in the woods.
At the Wexlow well, I angered something evil and powerful (named Gamjee, I think) to the point that it pulled me down into the well. I've landed at the well's bottom severly injured, but alive.
After I landed with a thud at the bottom of the well and being concussed, I began to hear sounds off in the distance. Were they voices? Were they even real? Maybe a symptom of the concussion perhaps?

After I landed with a thud at the bottom of the well and being concussed, I began to hear sounds off in the distance. Were they voices? Were they even real? Are they the voices of something more sinister?
The voices I thought I heard earlier seem to be persistent and seemed to be getting louder. It was hard to tell if they're real or just a figment of my imagination.
Deep inside the well's tunnels, I found eight people being held captive inside a very deep pit.
I learned that these people are held captive by a troll and they need me to find a way to free them.
I met the troll named Gamjee and listened to what he had to say.
In an attempt to help Gamjee and the villagers, I have facilitated a conversation between Gamjee and one of the villagers.
I killed Gamjee and in doing so, I found a rope that I think might be helpful in freeing those people in that pit.
I killed Gamjee and in doing so, I realized that I really should go investigate the voices I heard earlier.
The villagers have been freed. I should visit them back in their village of Wexlow.
The villagers and Gamjee agreed to a schedule for using the well, ensuring everyone has access to water without conflict. But the villagers are still in the pit.
After the villagers and Gamjee agreed to a compromise, Gamjee gave me a rope and instructed me to use it to free the remaining villagers in the pit.
I've visited the people of Wexlow Village after they made it home. They are happy to sleep in their own beds now.
Philippa, one of the lovely Feygard loyalist ladies from Wexlow that I rescued from Gamjee the troll has informed me that she is a master baker.
Philippa has educated me about what a "Feydelight" is.
In return for my helping to rescue Philippa, she's stated that she could make a "Feydelight" for me if I provide her with all of the ingredients necessary to bake one.
I need to find dough, two eggs, wine, butter, honey and five Feygard fig fruits. I can find the figs in Feygard, but maybe I could find some along the Duleian Road too?
She told me that I can find the dough in Brightport or Feygard, but I could find a baker in just about any town.
Philippa told me that I can get honey from a beekeeper. But where to find one?
I gave Philippa all the ingredients needed to bake the Feydelight. Now I just need to come back later.
I have received my Feydelight from Philippa.
